definition: what one has seen and heard/knowledge/one's experience
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to possess limited experience and knowledge (idiom)

sentences.english: The landlord aunt is always telling me much information about the Xinkai River.
sentences.chinese: 房东大娘总是会跟我讲关于新开河的见闻。

sentences.english: She is well-informed for a woman of the old school .
sentences.chinese: 以一个旧式的女人来说，她是见闻广博的。

sentences.english: It is generally thought that traveling abroad can enrich one's knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 一般认为出国旅游可增广见闻。

sentences.english: We all enter the world depending on what we can see.
sentences.chinese: 我们对世界的看法来自于我们的见闻。

sentences.english: I think former President Clinton will have some interesting information.
sentences.chinese: 我相信前总统克林顿会有些有趣的见闻。

sentences.english: And I vow to fathom the Tathagata's true meaning.
sentences.chinese: 我今见闻得受持，愿解如来真实义。

sentences.english: A broad range of horizons is donated to know?
sentences.chinese: 广博的见闻是赠给知识贫乏者的宝贵的精神食粮。

sentences.english: If you move people, they will think about what they have seen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你打动了人们，人们就会对他们的见闻进行思考。

sentences.english: He is a storehouse of information.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个见闻广博的人。

sentences.english: Most deans can tell stories of parents who lingered around campus for days.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学院院长都能讲出这些见闻。

sentences.english: Venus in the ninth house can signify love as an agent of consciousness expansion.
sentences.chinese: 金星位于第九宫可以表示，爱情是增长见闻的媒介。

sentences.english: Wisdom comes from extensive obull crapervation and broad knowledge.
You may be somewhat naïve, and you may need to be more realistic and informed.
sentences.chinese: 你可能有些单纯，需要更现实和增广见闻。

sentences.english: The Monkey is an intelligent person with good memory.
sentences.chinese: 猴是充足智慧的常识分子，见闻广博，有惊的纪念力。

definition: anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
various notes or records/a miscellany/scattered jottings
what one has learned (through experience, reading etc)/knowledge/insight/understanding/tips/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
